description.en: The course will provide a survey of the major developments in 20th century British literature from Modernist poetry and prose to today's multicultural and multiethnic writing. The main emphasis will be on reading and discussing texts by a range of representative authors, including Virginia Woolf, W.H. Auden, William Golding and Zadie Smith among others. The course will end in an oral examination.
description.et:
Kursus annab ülevaate olulisematest arengutest 20. sajandi Briti kirjanduses alates modernistlikust proosast ja luulest kuni tänapäeva multikultuurse ja paljurahvuselise kirjanduseni. Kursuse põhirõhk on representatiivsete autorite tekstide lugemisel, käsitlemisele tulevad nt Virgina Woolf, W.H.Auden, William Golding, Zadie Smith jpt.
Kursus lõpeb suulise eksamiga.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give a survey of 20th century British literature starting from the Modernist movement to the turn of the millennium. The course will provide insights into the period's literary history and enhance the student's skills of critical discussion, reflection and comparison as of modern poetry and fiction.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda ülevaade 20. sajandi briti kirjandusest alates modernistlikust liikumisest uue aastatuhande künniseni, tutvustada selle ajalugu ning süvendada kirjandusteoste analüüsimise ning seoste loomise oskusi.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the students will
1) have obtained a survey of the British literary history in the 20th century
learning_outcomes.et: 1) omavad ülevaadet briti kirjanduse ajaloost 20. sajandil;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) have acquired a toolkit of critical terms relevant to the period
learning_outcomes.et: 2) on tuttavad perioodiga seotud kirjandusteadusliku mõistestikuga;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) have improved their skills of close reading of fiction and poetry
learning_outcomes.et: 3) on harjutanud luule- ja proosatekstide praktilist lähilugemist.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Poetry by T.S. Eliot, D.H. Lawrence, W.H. Auden, Louis MacNeice, Dylan Thomas, Keith Douglas, Philip Larkin, Thom Gunn, Ted Hughes, Geoffrey Hill 
Fiction by Virginia Woolf, James Joyce, Aldous Huxley, Christopher Isherwood, Kingsley Amis, William Golding, John Fowles, Ian McEwan, Margaret Drabble, Zadie Smith
Andrew Sanders. The Short Oxford History of English Literature (2nd edition). Oxford: Clarendon Press. 2000
Malcolm Bradbury. The Modern British Novel. (revised edition) Harmondsworth etc.: Penguin. 2001 
Peter Childs. The Twentieth Century in Poetry: A Critical Survey. London, New York: Routledge. 1999
resources.recommended_materials:
Paul Poplawski (ed.). English Literature in Context. Cambridge: CUP, 2009.
Laura Marcus, Peter Nicholls (eds). The Cambridge History of Twentieth Century English Literature. Cambridge: CUP 2004.
Neil Corcoran. The Cambridge Companion to Twentieth-Century English Poetry. Cambridge: CUP, 2007.
Randall Stevenson. A Reader's Guide to Twentieth-Century Novel in Britain. Lexington: University Press of Kentucky. 1993.
Peter Childs. Modernism. London, New York: Routledge. 2004.
Samuel Hynes. The Auden Generation: Literature and Politics in England in the 1930s. London: Bodley Head, 1976.
Randall Stevenson. The British Novel since the Thirties. London: Batsford, 1987.
Blake Morrison. The Movement: English Poetry and Fiction of the 1950s. London, New York: Methuen, 1986.
John Brannigan. Orwell to the Present. Literature in England 1945-2000. Basingstoke; New York: Palgrave Macmillan, 2003.
Dominic Head. The Cambridge Introduction to Modern British Fiction, 1950-2000. Cambridge: CUP, 2002
John McRae, Ronald Carter. The Routledge Guide to Modern English Writing. London, New York: Routledge, 2004.
